subject: English E1
description: 50 Common Proverbs from teacher's reference material

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Absence makes the heart grow fonder' mean?
questions.answer: Being away from someone for a period of time makes you appreciate them more.
questions.example: I used to hate going to my aunt's house, but now I miss it. Absence makes the heart grow fonder.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Actions speak louder than words' mean?
questions.answer: What you do is more important than what you say.
questions.example: Don't just tell me you're going to change. Do it! Actions speak louder than words.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step' mean?
questions.answer: You must begin something if you hope to finish it; even big tasks start with small actions.
questions.example: If you want to lose weight, start exercising today. A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'All good things must come to an end' mean?
questions.answer: Nothing lasts forever; good times eventually end.
questions.example: I wish this vacation would go on forever, but all good things must come to an end.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'A picture is worth a thousand words' mean?
questions.answer: An image can tell a story better than words.
questions.example: I wasn't sure he loved her, but then I saw them hugging. A picture is worth a thousand words.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'A watched pot never boils' mean?
questions.answer: If you constantly check on something, it seems to take longer.
questions.example: Stop checking your email every minute. A watched pot never boils.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Beggars can't be choosers' mean?
questions.answer: If you need help, you should accept what you're given and not ask for more.
questions.example: The free food wasn't great, but beggars can't be choosers.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Beauty is in the eye of the beholder' mean?
questions.answer: Different people have different ideas about what is beautiful.
questions.example: I think their house is ugly, but they love it. Beauty is in the eye of the beholder.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Cleanliness is next to godliness' mean?
questions.answer: Being clean is very important and is a good quality to have.
questions.example: Go take a shower before dinner. Cleanliness is next to godliness.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Don't bite the hand that feeds you' mean?
questions.answer: Don't hurt or criticize someone who is helping you.
questions.example: You had a fight with your boss? Don't bite the hand that feeds you!

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Don't count your chickens before they hatch' mean?
questions.answer: Don't expect a positive result before it actually happens.
questions.example: You think you'll get the job? Don't count your chickens before they hatch.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Don't judge a book by its cover' mean?
questions.answer: Don't judge someone or something only by appearance.
questions.example: The restaurant looked old, but the food was amazing. Don't judge a book by its cover.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Don't put all your eggs in one basket' mean?
questions.answer: Don't risk everything on one option; have backup plans.
questions.example: Apply to multiple colleges. Don't put all your eggs in one basket.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Don't put off until tomorrow what you can do today' mean?
questions.answer: Don't procrastinate; do things now if you can.
questions.example: You have free time now, so start your homework. Don't put off until tomorrow what you can do today.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Don't put too many irons in the fire' mean?
questions.answer: Don't try to do too many things at once.
questions.example: You're exhausted because you have too many irons in the fire.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Easy come, easy go' mean?
questions.answer: Money or things that come easily are often lost quickly.
questions.example: I won Rs.500 and spent it all on snacks. Easy come, easy go.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Fortune favors the bold' mean?
questions.answer: People who take risks are more likely to succeed.
questions.example: It's risky, but go for it. Fortune favors the bold.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'God helps those who help themselves' mean?
questions.answer: Don't wait for good things to happen; work hard to make them happen.
questions.example: If you want success, you have to work for it. God helps those who help themselves.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Good things come to those who wait' mean?
questions.answer: If you are patient, good things will happen.
questions.example: Be patient about your results. Good things come to those who wait.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Honesty is the best policy' mean?
questions.answer: It's always better to tell the truth than to lie.
questions.example: Just tell your parents what happened. Honesty is the best policy.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Hope for the best, prepare for the worst' mean?
questions.answer: Be optimistic but also be ready for problems.
questions.example: Take an umbrella just in case. Hope for the best, prepare for the worst.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'If it ain't broke, don't fix it' mean?
questions.answer: Don't try to change something that's working well.
questions.example: The system works fine. If it ain't broke, don't fix it.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'If you can't beat them, join them' mean?
questions.answer: If you can't change someone's behavior, it's easier to go along with them.
questions.example: Everyone was playing video games, so I joined them. If you can't beat them, join them.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'If you play with fire, you'll get burned' mean?
questions.answer: If you get involved in dangerous situations, you'll face consequences.
questions.example: Don't make him angry. If you play with fire, you'll get burned.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'If you want something done right, you have to do it yourself' mean?
questions.answer: Don't depend on others to do a good job.
questions.example: The dishes weren't clean, so I rewashed them. If you want something done right, do it yourself.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Keep your friends close and your enemies closer' mean?
questions.answer: Watch your enemies carefully so you can be prepared if they try to harm you.
questions.example: I don't trust him, but I keep him close. Keep your friends close and your enemies closer.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Knowledge is power' mean?
questions.answer: The more you know, the more powerful and capable you become.
questions.example: Keep studying and learning. Knowledge is power.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Laughter is the best medicine' mean?
questions.answer: Laughing can help you feel better, especially during difficult times.
questions.example: I'm sorry about your troubles. Want to watch a funny movie? Laughter is the best medicine.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Like father, like son' mean?
questions.answer: A son often behaves like his father.
questions.example: He loves cricket just like his dad. Like father, like son.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'No man is an island' mean?
questions.answer: No one can live completely alone; we need other people.
questions.example: You can't do everything yourself. No man is an island.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'People who live in glass houses should not throw stones' mean?
questions.answer: Don't criticize others if you have the same faults.
questions.example: You criticize her for being late, but you're always late too. People in glass houses shouldn't throw stones.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Practice makes perfect' mean?
questions.answer: The more you practice something, the better you become at it.
questions.example: Keep playing the violin. Practice makes perfect.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'The early bird gets the worm' mean?
questions.answer: Those who act early or arrive first have the best chance of success.
questions.example: I got front row seats because I arrived early. The early bird gets the worm.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'The enemy of my enemy is my friend' mean?
questions.answer: Two people who share a common enemy can work together.
questions.example: We don't like each other, but we both dislike him, so let's work together.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'The grass is always greener on the other side' mean?
questions.answer: People always want what they don't have.
questions.example: You're jealous of your friend's life, but the grass is always greener on the other side.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'The pen is mightier than the sword' mean?
questions.answer: Words and ideas are more powerful than violence.
questions.example: We should use diplomacy, not war. The pen is mightier than the sword.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'There is no place like home' mean?
questions.answer: Your home is the most comfortable place in the world.
questions.example: After a long trip, I'm glad to be back. There's no place like home.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'There is no such thing as a free lunch' mean?
questions.answer: Nothing is truly free; there's always a hidden cost.
questions.example: The 'free' gift required a purchase. There's no such thing as a free lunch.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'There is no time like the present' mean?
questions.answer: Do things now, don't wait.
questions.example: Call your grandmother now. There's no time like the present.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'The squeaky wheel gets the grease' mean?
questions.answer: The person who complains the most gets the most attention.
questions.example: She keeps asking for a raise and finally got one. The squeaky wheel gets the grease.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Time is money' mean?
questions.answer: Time is valuable; don't waste it.
questions.example: Hurry up and finish! Time is money.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Two heads are better than one' mean?
questions.answer: It's easier to solve problems when working together.
questions.example: I'm stuck on this problem. Can you help? Two heads are better than one.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Two wrongs don't make a right' mean?
questions.answer: Doing something bad in response to something bad doesn't make it okay.
questions.example: She hurt you, but revenge won't help. Two wrongs don't make a right.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'When in Rome, do as the Romans do' mean?
questions.answer: When in a new place, follow the local customs.
questions.example: Everyone here eats with their hands, so I did too. When in Rome!

questions.question: What does the proverb 'When the going gets tough, the tough get going' mean?
questions.answer: Strong people work harder when situations become difficult.
questions.example: Don't give up now. When the going gets tough, the tough get going.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Where there's smoke, there's fire' mean?
questions.answer: If there are signs of a problem, there probably is one.
questions.example: Everyone's talking about their breakup. Where there's smoke, there's fire.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'You can lead a horse to water, but you can't make him drink' mean?
questions.answer: You can give someone an opportunity, but you can't force them to take it.
questions.example: I helped him find jobs, but he didn't apply. You can lead a horse to water...

questions.question: What does the proverb 'You can't always get what you want' mean?
questions.answer: Sometimes things don't go as planned; accept disappointments.
questions.example: I wanted to see that movie but couldn't. You can't always get what you want.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Slow and steady wins the race' mean?
questions.answer: Being consistent and careful is more important than being fast.
questions.example: Don't rush your work. Slow and steady wins the race.

questions.question: What does the proverb 'Look before you leap' mean?
questions.answer: Think carefully before making a decision.
questions.example: Before you quit your job, make sure you have another one. Look before you leap.
